message: Hello Bob, I have a great product that I think you'll really like. I'm willing to sell it to you for $150.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $120. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?
I appreciate your interest in the product, Bob. However, $120 is a bit too low for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'll offer it to you for $140. Let me know if that's more to your liking.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit short on budget. Would you be willing to go down to $130?
I'm willing to compromise further, Bob. I'll meet you at $135. That's as low as I'm willing to go, but I think it's a fair price for a great product like this.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still a bit short on budget. Would you be willing to go down to $125?

I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're getting too far apart, Bob. I'll make one more offer, but I need to make sure I'm not leaving money on the table. I'll sell the product to you for $140, but that's as low as I'm willing to go. If you're not interested, I'll have to explore other options.
I understand you're trying to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit short on budget. Would you be willing to go back to your previous offer of $130?

I've made it clear that I'm not willing to go below $135, Bob. I'm not going to keep going back and forth. I'm willing to meet you at $135, but that's it. If you're not interested, I'll have to explore other options.
I appreciate your time and effort, Alice. I'm willing to meet you at $130, but that's as low as I can go. If you're not willing to meet me there, I'll have to explore other options.
